column4: hewhat should i do when ubuntu stops responding? like ctrl+alt+delete in windows
what should i do when ubuntu stops responding? like ctrl+alt+delete in windows
ctrl+alt+backspace will restart X, ctrl+alt+f1 will get you to a console where you can do other things, otherwise hit your reset button / do a hard-reboot

what do you mean "restore from crash"?

what part does not respond? can you boot to a recovery console?
the desktop does not respond it's very unstable. how do i restor back to normal?
how to boot on to recovery console?
when you're booting, after the BIOS, when grub appears "Press ESC for menu" or something like that, press Esc and choose "Boot to recovery console" or something like that
then you can remove whatever package you added that isn't working
